turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What the fuck is he doing?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Maybe it's a game.  Maybe he's trying to send us a message.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: It doesn't matter now.  We've just got to be the first ones there.  Get everybody up.  I want them all activated.

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: All of them?

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Abbott.  He knows about the embassy. He's coming down for a show and tell.

turns.speaker: CONKLIN
turns.text: That'll solve all our problems.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY DCM
turns.text: -- what're you talking about? --

turns.speaker: SECURITY CHIEF
turns.text: -- we're evacuating the building --

turns.speaker: DEPUTY DCM
turns.text: -- we're in the middle of a trade meeting! --

turns.speaker: SECURITY CHIEF
turns.text: -- call the code! -- I want everyone out! --

turns.speaker: DEPUTY DCM
turns.text: -- you gotta give me more to go on --

turns.speaker: SECURITY CHIEF
turns.text: -- he's running from the cops, he's got a bag filled with God knows what, he's in the building and I don't know where! --

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: You're awake.  Can you hear me?  You've been shot.  I'm trying to help you.  You were in the water.  You've been shot.  It's okay now.

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: You're American.  I thought so. From your teeth -- the dental work --

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: <u>Where am I</u>?

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: You're on a boat.  A fishing boat. Italian flag.  We're out of Vietri.  It's the cold that saved you.  The water.  The wounds are clean.  I'm not a doctor, but the wounds, it looks okay.  It's clean.

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: How did I get here?

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: You we're lost at sea.  They pulled you out.  Who are you?  You were shot -- two bullets -- in the back.  You understand me?  Who are you?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: What if it doesn't come back?

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: I told you.  You need to rest.

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: It came from your hip.  Under the skin.  You have a bank in Zurich.  You remember Zurich?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: Look, I'm just on this boat, okay? I'm an engineer.  Whatever this is, it's not for me to be involved, okay?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: I don't remember Zurich.

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: You drink rum?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GIANCARLO
turns.text: It's not much, but it should get you to Switzerland.

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: I won't forget this.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ervices.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Uh - what? - I ...

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...Be back.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ergency procedures.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I haven't got an emergency. Get out of here.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...your ducts?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I fixed it myself.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... And then some.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What have you done to my flat?

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: You telephone, sir.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...elephoned sir.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Trouble with your air-conditioning.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ditioning.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ixed itself.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Machines don't fix themselves.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... fix themselves.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: He's tampered with it, Dowser.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ampered. with it, Spoor.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: I think we'd better have a look.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... have a look.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: What have you got there?

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: Got there!

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Mumble ... mumble ... mumble ... Tuttle

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: Mumble ... Tuttle ...

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Tuttle! ... mumble!  You've had that scab Tuttle here, haven't you?

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...aven't you?

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Oh yeh? Where'd you get this from eh  out yer nostril?

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...Yer nostril?

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Central Services don't take kindly to sabotage!

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...sabotage!

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...ven't you?

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: You're putting your talents to very odd use Mr Lowry - yes, odd use - to pit wits against Central Services -

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ...sod you, stupid twit.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Sign here, please.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... ere please.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: This is what you get when you have cowboys round yer ducts.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... yer ducts.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: I think you've got your T41 crystal inductor wired up to a reverse bobbin- threaded-solenoid-control. It's either that or a new washer.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... new washer.

turns.speaker: SPOOR
turns.text: Sign the form so we can get to it.

turns.speaker: DOWSER
turns.text: ... get to it.

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: Ah ha ... there you are, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What? How do you know my name?

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: We know everything here. This is the Storeroom of Knowledge.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then perhaps you can help me. I've lost someone who ...

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: We know that too. You've come to the right place.

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: Oh, yes. We've got everything here. Every bit of knowledge, wisdom, learning ... every experience, every thought neatly filed away.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What? You mean you've got ...

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: Well not exactly. But, if you help us we'll help you. The Forces Of Darkness have won the day ... but, tomorrow is another one

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do I have to do.

turns.speaker: GENT
turns.text: You must save the day.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Er ... Thanks ...

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: It's reply paid.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh ...  Thank you very much, mother, but actually -

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: You don't have to sing it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, right ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Aren't you a bit late? - the party started half an hour ago.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Yes, I know. It's the backlog, everybody complains. Was it all right otherwise?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, it was ... very nice ... thank you.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Do you mind if I use your bathroom?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: GIRL BUTTLE
turns.text: Her name is Jill.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What? ...Jill? Jill who? Jill who?

turns.speaker: GIRL BUTTLE
turns.text: Layton.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jill Layton ...  You're a very good little girl. What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GIRL BUTTLE
turns.text: I'm waiting for my daddy.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He will be pleased when he comes home.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: Deputy minister, what do you believe is behind this recent increase in terrorist bombings?

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Bad sportsmanship. A ruthless minority of people seems to have forgotten certain good old fashioned virtues. They just can't stand seeing the other fellow win. If these people would just play the game, instead of standing on the touch line heckling -

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: In fact, killing people -

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: - In fact, killing people - they'd get a lot more out of life.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: Mr. HELPMANN, what would you say to those critics who maintain that the Ministry Of Information has become too large and unwieldy ...?

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: David ... in a free society information is the name of the game. You can't win the game if you're a man short.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: And the cost of it all, Deputy Minister? Seven percent of the gross national produce ...

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: I understand this concern on behalf of the tax-payers. People want value for money and a cost-effective service.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: Do you think that the government is winning the battle against terrorists?

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: On yes. Our morale is much higher than theirs, we're fielding all their strokes, running a lot of them out, and pretty consistently knocking them for six. I'd say they're nearly out of the game.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: But the bombing campaign is now in its thirteenth year ...

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Beginner's luck.

turns.speaker: INTERVIEWER
turns.text: Thank you very much, Deputy Minister.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Thank you, David ... and a very merry Christmas to you all.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Thanks very much Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's all right Mr Helpmann. Glad to help.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: If I can help you ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, I ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sorry ...

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Your father and I were very close. Of course Jeremiah was senior to me but we were close friends ... especially after the bombing  and I  keep his name alive at the office every day.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: I know he would have wanted me to help you ... And I promised your mother I'd take you onto the team at information Retrieval. But I gather that ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mr Helpmann. I've changed my mind. I'd like to accept the transfer - am I too late?

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Too late? That's for me to say.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well ... well, I ...

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Sam, what are we going to do with you? Can you hear me, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Where's Jill? What have you done to her? Where is she?!

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Gillian Layton?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, you've got to get me out of here. I've got to find her.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: I understand, Sam, I know exactly how you feel. So I brought you a bottle of barley water.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Help me!

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: I assure you, Sam, I'm doing everything within my power. But the rules of the game are laid down, and we all have to play by them - even me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is all a mistake! Don't you understand?!

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Yes, well, from the Department's point of view you're certainly a bit of an own goal, but ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not a terrorist! You must know that! I'm not guilty! Get me out of here!

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Sam, if you've been going out there and playing a straight bat, all the way down the line, you've got absolutely nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Please, I've got to find Jill.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Sam, I think I ought to tell you ... I'm afraid she's upped stumps and retired to the pavilion.

turns.speaker: HELPMANN
turns.text: Yes, it's all a bit confusing but, it seems she was killed resisting arrest.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, no ... I did that...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sam!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Long time no see!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, since you disappeared up the ladder of Information Retrieval ... I don't expect to see you slumming in Records - what's the problem?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Problem? - No problem - yes, everything's going fantastically well, wonderful, marvelous, great career prospects, Alison in great shape, kids fine, beautiful home, I'm on Security Level Five now, and Mr Helpmann relies on me more and more, yes, couldn't be better, I feel terrifically motivated and job- rewarded -

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You sound worried.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me? - if I'm worried about anyone, it's you. What happened to you, Sam? You were the brightest of us -

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sorry. Nothing.  See you - I'm going to be late.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You are late.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Even later.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sam, your life is going wrong - let your friends tell you - Records is a dead end department, no Security Level worth a damn, it's impossible to get noticed -

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, I know, fantastic, marvellous, wonderful - remember me to Alison - and the - er - twins.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Triplets.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Really? - God, how time flies!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hello, Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You remember Alison?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: {winking at Sam) She doesn't like me telling anyone but she's pleased as anything really.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Er, I knew you looked different.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remember how they used to stick out?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What? - Oh, yes - vividly. I used to wonder if they were real.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dr. Jaffe has pinned her ears back.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Quite, absolutely - I always thought they were false.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mr Helpmann!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: SAM! What a surprise!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Are you officer 412/L?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sorry about that ... Mr Helpmann told me you were coming aboard - congratulations!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks. Are you officer 412/L?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For my sins. Are you settling in alright?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, thanks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Terrific. I'm really glad you dropped by. Unfortunately, I don't have any time right now I've got a queue of customers to deal with - er, why don't we have a drink tonight?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ah ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't want to take up your time now, but I was hoping you could give me some information on somebody. It's a security level three matter and Information Retrieval records says to refer to you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: OK. Come back this afternoon, about four o'clock. If you give me the number of the case, I'll have the dossier here waiting.  My tailor,... well worth the investment.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've got numbers all over these - I'm not sure which is the one you want.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Layton! Oh shit!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You clever bastard! I might have guessed. You only moved in today and you're already hot on the bloody trail.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Am I?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please, Sam, we're going to have to be open to each other on this one. If you make a reputation with this case, it'll be at my expense.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How much do you know?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not much.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Enough though, eh?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not really, no.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: OK. OK. Let's not fence around ... This is the situation. Some idiot somewhere in the building, some insect, confused two of our clients, B58/732 and T47/215.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: B58/732, that's A. Buttle isn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Christ! You do know it all!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, no, I don't. I'm just beginning Honestly. Sorry, carry on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, your A. Buttle has been confused with T47/215, an A. Tuttle. I mean, it's a joke! Somebody should be shot for that. So B58/732 was pulled in by mistake.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You got the wrong man.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I did not get the wrong man. I got the right man. The wrong man was delivered to me as the right man! I accepted him, on trust, as the right man. Was I wrong? Anyway, to add to the confusion, he died on us. Which, had he been the right man, he wouldn't have done.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You killed him?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sam, there are very rigid parameters laid down to avoid that event but Buttle's heart condition did not appear on Tuttle's file. Don't think I'm dismissing this business, Sam. I've lost a week's sleep over it already.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sure you have

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There are some real bastards in this department who don't mind breaking a few eggs to make an omelette, but thank God there are the new boys like me who want to maintain decent civilized standards of terrorist eradication. We've got the upper hand for the moment, but they're waiting for us to slip up, and a little slip- up like this is just the chance they're looking for.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So how ...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What I've got to do now is pick up Tuttle, interrogate him at the same voltage as Buttle, to the same meter reading to the last penny, and juggle the books in electrical banking.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What has Tuttle done?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We suspect him of freelance subversion.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's a freelance subversive?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's a compulsive heating engineer. A maverick ex-Central Service repair man with a grudge against society. Now, fortunately, we're nearly out of the wood, I think. At least we will be when I get this Layton woman under arrest.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's she done?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You didn't know as much about this business as you pretended to, did you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Er ... no.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Very smart.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Er ... but I would've found out anyway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes. I'm impressed.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Tell me about Layton.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She witnessed the Tuttle arrest - the Buttle arrest - and since then she's been making wild allegations, obviously trying to exploit the situation - she's working for somebody, and she's not working for us.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: A terrorist?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But surely, I mean, perhaps she just happened to live above the Buttles, and ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look after that suit, eh. Barbara chose it for me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Right. Er, you're not going to keep calling her Barbara, are you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Barbara's a perfectly good name, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Look, about the Layton woman - maybe she's just trying to help the Buttle family.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why? Hell, not for any reason ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: {baffled) I don't follow you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Out of kindness.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kindness? What's the purpose behind this line of enquiry?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: So what are you going to do about her?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get her out of circulation - I've put her on the detention list.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You mean you're going to invite her in so that she can spill the beans inside the department?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I ... Good point. What do you suggest?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Let me try to get to her. I'll deactivate her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What does that mean? I don't want to be involved in anything unsavoury.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Trust me. You do trust me, don't you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course. We went to school together. You're my oldest friend.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And you're mine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're the only person I can trust.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Then we'd better keep this business just between the two of us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right! Just between as and the Security Forces.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: They weren't at school with us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But, I've already put her on the search and detain list.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Take her off the list.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's no procedure for that until she's been arrested.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Say it was a mistake.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We don't make mistakes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, I'd better get out there and try to get to her before security does. Let me borrow her dossier for a while.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Er ... alright. For Christ's sake don't lose it. Here, you'd better sign for it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks, Jack. I'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you know what you're doing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Trust me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sam ... we're proud to have you at Information Retrieval. Merry Xmas.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Come off it, Jack! Of course you can check to see if she's been arrested.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry, Sam, I'm afraid this whole case has become much more complicated since last we talked.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: She's innocent, Jack --- she's done nothing wrong.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tell that to the wives of the Security men she blew up this afternoon. Listen, we've also had a report just in from Central Services that Tuttle has wrecked an entire flat and sabotaged adjacent Central Services systems - as a matter of fact, in your block. I'd keep my eyes open if I were you, Sam. Bye.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't really think Tuttle and the girl are in league?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I do. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It could all be coincidental.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There are no coincidences, Sam. Everything's connected, all along the line. Cause and effect. That's the beauty of it. Our job is to trace the connections and reveal them.  This whole Buttle/Tuttle confusion was obviously planned from the inside. Bye bye.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack, she's innocent!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sam - we've always been close, haven't we?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes we have, Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, could you stay away from me until this thing blows over.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack?... Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack, I'm innocent! Help me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bastard!!!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is all a mistake. Jack, please take that mask off.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You stupid bastard!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How could you do this to me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Help me, Jack! I'm frightened!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How do you think I feel? You shit!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jack ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shut up! This is a professional relationship!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I want to report a wrongful arrest.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: You want Information Adjustments. Different department.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I've been to Information Adjustments. They sent me here. They told me you had a form I had to fill in.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Have you got an Arrest Receipt?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Is it stamped?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Stamped?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: No, there's no stamp on it. You see! I can't give you the form until it's stamped.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Where do I get it stamped?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Information Adjustments.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: But you've stamped this form before! Why won't you stamp it now?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: You've just said yourself, Miss, we've already stamped it. Why should we stamp it twice?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: You're a stupid, fat arsed, obstructive, fascist moron aren't you?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: You think these are tits don't you?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I bet you'd like to touch them?

turns.speaker: PORTER
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well don't. You're looking at twenty pounds of high explosive! And if you don't stamp this form I'm going to blow the place up!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's you ... it's you ...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Mrs Buttle, are you alright?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Who are you? Let go!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't look back! Act naturally!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: How can I act naturally, when you've trying to break my arm?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ow! That hurt!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Good!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What are you doing? For Christ's sake! Get moving!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Bloody hell! Do as I say!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Please!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Alright! Alright! Alright! I'm Information Retrieval Officer -  DZ/015, and I'm arresting you for - your own good! Now start up and get moving before I hand you back to them!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Them?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Us. Them. I don't know ... just get going.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Don't litter my cab!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, sorry.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: ... This is amazing ... for me ... being here with you. I mean, in my dreams you ...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't want to hear about your fucking dreams!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh. But ... Look, I'm sorry I shouted at you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Why are they all pigs at Information Retrieval?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.  Hey, that's not a very nice thing to say.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You know, smoking's bad for you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: It's my fucking life.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, of course. Sorry.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I know you. I saw you through the floor, didn't I?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes. Ceiling. Why did you run away?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I didn't run away. I left the flat.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I didn't like it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: It had a hole in the floor. Where are we going?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Where are you taking me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Where are you taking me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ah ... Er ... It looks as if you're taking me.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: It does doesn't it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Where are you taking me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's going on here?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What does it look like ... I'm collecting empties.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: OK. What's in the parcel?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What parcel?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's heavy.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: A heavy Christmas present.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What are you doing in Information Retrieval?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Looking for you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No, really.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I mean, it doesn't suit you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Suit me?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Don't you know the sort of thing that Information Retrieval does?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do you mean? Would you rather have terrorists?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: We've got both.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Things would be worse without Information Retrieval.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: They couldn't be worse for the Buttles.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Why don't you say, no system is perfect.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, no system is.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Say, all wars have innocent victims.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, all wars do -

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Who is this war against, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, terrorists of course.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: How many terrorists have you met? Actual terrorists?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Actual. terrorists? Well ... it's only my first day.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Look at that - right on time.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What? I thought you were free to come and go as you please.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well, almost ... unfortunately I do have to punch in by 5.00 every day.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Every day?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Turn around!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: They'll be there waiting.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Who will?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Security.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: You're joking.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No. Please. They're going to arrest you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I thought you arrested me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes ... but, this is real. Now, stop!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Cut it out, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Will you please turn back.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Get away!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Turn!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Stop it ... damn you!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was right! Step on it!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Let go! We've got to stop!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Now you're the one that's out of your mind.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Sam ... we can't outrace them. You'll kill us!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Come on, let's go! Let's get out of here!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh God! What have we done?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: We? Don't blame me!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It wasn't supposed to happen like this.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Shit! The house is on fire!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: "And your children all gone."

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: "Lady bird, lady bird, fly away home, your house is on fire and your children all gone" ... Do you think anyone's hurt?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Yes.  Come out, I know you're in there

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is a hell of a time to buy a nightie.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Are you still following me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Please, Jill ... I love you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There are plenty of other safe places. Why don't we go back to my flat?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Leave me alone!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You've got to trust me. It sounds silly but I know we were meant to meet.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: You mean you were meant to hijack my truck, make me crash it, and have every security man in town looking for me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I vas just trying to help. I decided to trust you. Maybe I was wrong. Whose side are you on really? Who are your friends? Who was the man who gave you the parcel? What's in it? It's the only thing you saved from the lorry .... It must he something very special.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I saved you from the lorry and you're not very special.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: ........... It's a bomb isn't it?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Oh ... Jesus!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm going to open it!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No you're not!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jill! What are you do ... I mean ... how did you ... Are you alright?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What happened to you after ...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Your face ... are you hurt?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No. No. I'm fine. I was worried sick about you ... I thought ...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: They're gone.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Don't you like parties?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: C'mon. We've got to get out of here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Make yourself at home. Don't answer the phone or open he door to anyone. I won't be long.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm going to pull some strings. It's our only hope.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Don't do anything silly.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Take care.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: What do you think? ... is it me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't exist any more. I've killed you. Jill Layton is dead.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Perhaps the machine's on the blink! It keeps picking up old films. That can't he right, can it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's not the machine. There's a mismatch on the personnel code numbers... Ah there we go! That's a B58/732 when it should be a T47/215 ... Tuttle ... he should have £31.06, debited against his account for electrical procedures, not Buttle.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Oh my God, a mistake!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's not our mistake!

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Isn't it? Whose is it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Information Retrieval.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Oh, good!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Expediting has put in for electrical procedures in respect of Buttle, Archibald, shoe repair operative, but Security has invoiced Admin for Tuttle, Archibald, heating engineer

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: What a relief! I don't know what I'd do if you ever got promoted.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: But if they did promote you

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've told you before. I'd turn it down.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Would you really, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: You've been promoted.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: It's your mother isn't it? Pulling strings again.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What a BITCH!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: A cheque.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: The refund for Tuttle!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Tuttle?

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: I mean, Buttle! It's been confusion from the word go! He's been wrongly charged for Electromemorytherapy and someone somewhere is trying to make us carry the can!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've never seen a Ministry cheque before.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: We've got to get rid of it! There's been a balls-up somewhere, and when the music stops they'll jump on whoever's holding the cheque!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Send it to somebody else. Send it to Buttle. It's his cheque.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: I've tried that! Population Census have got him down as dormanted, the Central Collective Storehouse computer has got him down as deleted, and the Information Retrieval have got him down as inoperative ... Security has him down as excised., Admin have him down as completed

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hang on.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He is dead.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Dead! Oh no! That's terrible! We'll never get rid of the damned thing! What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Try next of kin.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Next of kin!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There we go. Mrs. Veronica Buttle. What's the number on the cheque?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Problem. She doesn't have a bank account.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Well, that's it! I may as well go and hang myself! This sort of thing couldn't have happened before the stupid seventh tier reorganization! That was Simmons doing! And he and Jeffries always sit together at lunch! The bastards!  Ow!  Perhaps we can lose it ... behind the filing cabinet ... or destroy it ... burn it ... eat it ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You'd never get away with it. Besides, you can't do that to somebody's refund. It's Christmas. There is one more option.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Drive out to Mrs Buttle, give her the cheque, tell her to sign her name on the back, cash it at the corner sweet shop.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Here. What do I do next?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Call the motor pool and authorise personal transport.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Of course, of course. Leave it to me. How do I authorize a cheque?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Here we are. Pink and blue receipts. All you've got to do is sign these and the back of the cheque.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Oh God! I think I've broken a bone. What a pathetic thing I am.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: You are good to me Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't mention it. See you later.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Is it all right about Mrs Buttle's cheque?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I delivered it.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Can I forget it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Damn! Blast!

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't happen to know how I can get around an IRQ/3 do you?

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: All information on 3rd Level Suspects is classified.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: All enquiries to Information Retrieval. Which is hopeless, of course. They never tell you anything. But come the time they want something from us ...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've go to accept that promotion to get behind this, haven't I?

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: Yes.  NO! You can't! You've only just turned it down!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I never signed the form.

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: I did it for you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What! Shit!

turns.speaker: KURTZMAN
turns.text: It's what you wanted isn't it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes ... No ... I don't, know.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: No, you can't have any more chairs! There's only one left in here now, and I need that to sit on!  Oh ... er, sorry. Who are you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sam Lowry.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: Ah, yes, you're the new boy from next door, ha ha!  My name's Lime. Harvey Lime. Welcome to Expediting.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ah.  Would you mind if I borrowed your computer console?

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'll bring it back in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: You want to take my console into your office?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: I'll tell you what .... You tell me what and I'll do it for. I'm a bit of a whizz on this thing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Alright. There's someone I want to check out. A woman called Gillian Layton.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: A woman eh? I see.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know her age and distinguishing marks. But I need an address or a place of work or something

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: This is your dream girl, is it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?  Look, let me use the console for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: LIME
turns.text: You must be joking -  When there's a woman involved - there's no stopping me. Now, let me have that sheet.
